snippet: Turkey’s leader on Monday said his political opponents were behind the violent demonstrations that have convulsed several Turkish cities.
abstract: Turkey's Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan announces that spate of violent demonstrations, which are continuing for fourth day in major Turkish cities, are work of extremists led by political opponents trying to overthrow his government; amidst reports of two deaths, Pres Abdullah Gul calls for calm from all sides and says demonstrations are natural part of democracy.

byline.contributor: C. J. Chivers contributed reporting from Antakya, Turkey, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Turkey’s leader on Monday said his political opponents were behind the violent demonstrations that have convulsed several Turkish cities.

headline.seo: Turkey’s Leader Blames Extremists for Protests
headline.main: Turkish Premier Blames Extremists for Protests as Two Are Killed
headline.print_headline: Turkish Premier Blames Extremists for Protests as Two Are Killed
